configuration_examples.ospf_basic:
To configure OSPF on this router:
1. Enter global configuration: configure terminal
2. Enable OSPF process: router ospf 1
3. Set router ID: router-id 1.1.1.1
4. Add networks: network 192.168.1.0 0.0.0.255 area 0
5. Configure passive interfaces: passive-interface default
6. Activate needed interfaces: no passive-interface GigabitEthernet0/0
configuration_examples.vlan_creation:
To create and configure VLANs:
1. Create VLAN: vlan 100
2. Name the VLAN: name Sales
3. Configure access port: interface gi1/0/5
4. Set access mode: switchport mode access
5. Assign to VLAN: switchport access vlan 100
6. Enable port: no shutdown
configuration_examples.bgp_neighbor:
To configure BGP neighbor:
1. Enter BGP configuration: router bgp 65001
2. Add neighbor: neighbor 203.0.113.1 remote-as 65000
3. Set description: neighbor 203.0.113.1 description ISP-Connection
4. Advertise networks: network 192.168.1.0 mask 255.255.255.0

troubleshooting_examples.ospf_neighbor_down:
When OSPF neighbors won't form:
1. Check interface status: show ip interface brief
2. Verify OSPF configuration: show ip ospf interface
3. Check neighbor table: show ip ospf neighbor
4. Common causes: mismatched area, network statements, authentication, or MTU mismatch
5. Debug if needed: debug ip ospf adj (use carefully)
troubleshooting_examples.bgp_idle_state:
When BGP neighbor is in Idle state:
1. Verify connectivity: ping neighbor-ip
2. Check BGP configuration: show ip bgp summary
3. Verify AS numbers match configuration
4. Check for access-lists blocking TCP 179
5. Review BGP logs: show log | include BGP
troubleshooting_examples.vlan_connectivity:
When VLAN connectivity fails:
1. Check VLAN exists: show vlan brief
2. Verify port assignment: show interface status
3. Check trunk configuration: show interface trunk
4. Verify inter-VLAN routing: show ip route
5. Test with ping and check ARP tables

explanation_examples.ospf_areas:
OSPF areas provide hierarchical network design:
- Area 0 (backbone) connects all other areas
- Standard areas contain internal routers
- Stub areas block external routes
- Totally stubby areas block external and inter-area routes
- NSSA areas allow limited external route injection
explanation_examples.bgp_path_selection:
BGP uses this path selection process:
1. Highest Weight (Cisco proprietary)
2. Highest Local Preference
3. Locally originated routes
4. Shortest AS Path
5. Lowest Origin (IGP < EGP < Incomplete)
6. Lowest MED
7. eBGP over iBGP
8. Shortest IGP path to next-hop
9. Lowest router ID
explanation_examples.vlan_benefits:
VLANs provide several network benefits:
- Broadcast domain segmentation reduces network congestion
- Improved security through traffic isolation
- Flexible network design independent of physical layout
- Easier network management and troubleshooting
- Support for different network policies per VLAN
